DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Growth Hormone Injection Route of Administration Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether growth hormone injections were administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Growth Hormone Injection Route of Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any agent that is chemically identical to, similar to or can be used as a replacement for endogenous human growth hormone (GH).:Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any agent that is chemically identical to, similar to or can be used as a replacement for endogenous human growth hormone (GH).

Concepts.definition: Any agent that is chemically identical to, similar to or can be used as a replacement for endogenous human growth hormone (GH).

Property.preferredDefinition: Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot."

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Yes, and the condition is still present
